meanings.sent1: He suckholed his friend by lying about the stolen cookie.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to suckhole her way into getting what she wants.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox suckholed the rabbit with promises of a magical carrot.
meanings.sent4: The con artist suckholed innocent people out of their life savings.
meanings.sent5: The villain's plan to suckhole the hero was foiled by a clever sidekick.

meanings.definition: To flatter or be overly nice to someone in order to gain favor.
meanings.sent1: The student suckholed the teacher with compliments to get a better grade.
meanings.sent2: She always suckholes her boss to get promoted.
meanings.sent3: The cat suckholed its way into extra treats by purring nonstop.
meanings.sent4: The politician suckholed the voters with promises he couldn't keep.
meanings.sent5: The salesman tried to suckhole the customer into buying a useless product.

meanings.definition: To be in a difficult or unpleasant situation.
meanings.sent1: They found themselves suckholed in a maze with no way out.
meanings.sent2: She felt suckholed when her car broke down in the middle of nowhere.
meanings.sent3: The team was suckholed into a tough match against the champions.
meanings.sent4: The hiker was suckholed on a steep cliff with no way down.
meanings.sent5: The family was suckholed in a traffic jam for hours.
